text: Harry Andrew Blackmun (November 12, 1908 â€“ March 4, 1999) was an American lawyer and jurist who served as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States from 1970 until 1994. Appointed by Republican President Richard Nixon, Blackmun ultimately became one of the most liberal justices on the Court. He is best known as the author of the Court's opinion in Roe v. Wade, which prohibits many state and federal restrictions on abortion. Blackmun studied at Harvard College, at Harvard Law School. Blackmun was never married. He had no children. Blackmun died on March 4, 1999 in Arlington County, Virginia from natural causes, aged 90. ==References== ==Other websites== * Excerpt from Blackmun's Callins opinion, and Justice Scalia's response * NPR series on Justice Blackmun's Files * Blackmun's Papers at the Library of Congress * Transcript: The Justice Harry A. title: Harry Blackmun
